---
title: Android Studio Setup
description: Android Studio Setup for MiniPay devs
---
import ColoredText from '/src/components/ColoredText';

<ColoredText>MiniPay</ColoredText> is currently only available for <ColoredText>Android phones</ColoredText>, as it is integrated into Opera Mini.

In case you might not have an Android device and in order to test and view dApps when building on MiniPay, you can use an <ColoredText>Android Emulator</ColoredText>!

:::warning
You <ColoredText>cannot register a new account</ColoredText> for MiniPay using Android Studio, you can only access existing accounts.
:::

In this guide, you will learn how you can setup an Android Simulator to test MiniPay dApps!

## Installing Android Studio

1. Download <ColoredText>[Android Studio](https://developer.android.com/studio)</ColoredText>.

![download android studio](/img/build/build-on-minipay/prerequisites/android-studio-setup/1.png)

2. <ColoredText>Select the right version</ColoredText> according to your OS and Mac version.

![mac version](/img/build/build-on-minipay/prerequisites/android-studio-setup/2.png)

3. Add it to your Applications (if you are on Mac) and <ColoredText>perform the setup</ColoredText>.

If asked for Android Simulator, tick it!

![add to applications](/img/build/build-on-minipay/prerequisites/android-studio-setup/3.png)

4. On successful setup this is how your <ColoredText>UI</ColoredText> for Android Studio will look like.

![android studio first screen](/img/build/build-on-minipay/prerequisites/android-studio-setup/4.png)

5. Click the <ColoredText>three dots</ColoredText> on right top corner and open <ColoredText>"Virtual Device Manager"</ColoredText>.

![open virtual device manager](/img/build/build-on-minipay/prerequisites/android-studio-setup/5.png)

6. The Device Manager will show all the existing available devices and you can add a new one by clicking the <ColoredText>+ button</ColoredText>

![add virtual device](/img/build/build-on-minipay/prerequisites/android-studio-setup/6.png)

7. Add <ColoredText>"Pixel 4"</ColoredText> that has the Play Store icon and click <ColoredText>"Next"</ColoredText>.

![add device with play store icon](/img/build/build-on-minipay/prerequisites/android-studio-setup/7.png)

8. Select the <ColoredText>"Tiramisu"</ColoredText> system image that will run inside the device you selected and click "Next".

![select system image](/img/build/build-on-minipay/prerequisites/android-studio-setup/8.png)

9. You can <ColoredText>edit the AVD name</ColoredText> in this step, the AVD name is used to launch the device from the terminal.

Keep the orientation as Portrait for development purposes.

You can now click <ColoredText>"Finish"</ColoredText>!

![avd config](/img/build/build-on-minipay/prerequisites/android-studio-setup/9.png)

10. You should now be able to see the device in the <ColoredText>"Device Manager"</ColoredText>!

You can use the <ColoredText>Play button</ColoredText> to start the device!

![start the device](/img/build/build-on-minipay/prerequisites/android-studio-setup/10.png)

11. On <ColoredText>successful launch</ColoredText> you should see the device!

<img
  src={"/img/build/build-on-minipay/prerequisites/android-studio-setup/11.png"}
  style={{ width: 250 }}
  alt="Open MiniPay dApp test page"
/>

#### Now you can follow the steps to [install MiniPay](http://docs.celo.org/developer/build-on-minipay/overview#installing-minipay) on the device!
